cmd.name: cmd
cmd.description: Command-line interface module for ComputerCraft that provides a REPL-style command processor with support for custom commands, autocompletion, and command history. Features: Built-in commands (clear, exit, help), command history navigation, tab autocompletion for commands and arguments, colored output for different message types, table pretty-printing functionality, and string utility functions (split, startsWith).

functions.name: string.split

params.name: sep?
params.description: The separator to split on (defaults to each character)

params.name: plain?
params.description: Whether to treat separator as plain text (no pattern matching)

functions.returns: string[] # Array of split substrings
functions.description: Split a string into an array of substrings based on a separator

functions.name: string.startsWith

params.name: target
params.description: The substring to look for at the beginning

params.name: caseSensitive?
params.description: Whether the comparison should be case-sensitive (defaults to false)

functions.returns: boolean # True if the string starts with the target
functions.description: Check if a string starts with a target substring

turtle-tracker.name: turtle-tracker
turtle-tracker.description: A turtle API client module for ComputerCraft that provides easy integration with the krawlet-api turtle tracking system. Features: Automatic stat tracking, position reporting, configurable API endpoint, periodic sync support, and simple state management for turtle data.

functions.name: module.setEndpoint

params.name: endpoint
params.description: The base URL of the turtle API (e.g., "http://localhost:3000")

functions.description: Set the API endpoint URL

functions.name: module.getEndpoint
functions.returns: string # The current API endpoint URL
functions.description: Get the current API endpoint

functions.name: module.init
functions.description: Initialize the turtle API client

functions.name: module.setDefault
functions.description: Set default stats (similar to CC state.setDefault pattern)

functions.name: module.getStats
functions.returns: TurtleStats # Current stats table
functions.description: Get the current stats

functions.name: module.getStat
functions.returns: number # The stat value
functions.description: Get a specific stat value

functions.name: module.setStat
functions.description: Set a specific stat value

functions.name: module.incrementStat

params.name: statName
params.description: Name of the stat to increment

functions.description: Increment a stat by a value (default 1)

functions.name: module.decrementStat

params.name: statName
params.description: Name of the stat to decrement

functions.description: Decrement a stat by a value (default 1)

functions.name: module.setAbsolutePosition
functions.description: Set the absolute position (world coordinates)

functions.name: module.getAbsolutePosition
functions.returns: TurtlePosition # Absolute position table
functions.description: Get the absolute position

functions.name: module.setRelativePosition
functions.description: Set the relative position (from starting point)

functions.name: module.getRelativePosition
functions.returns: TurtlePosition # Relative position table
functions.description: Get the relative position

functions.name: module.moveRelative
functions.description: Update relative position by offset

functions.name: module.moveAbsolute
functions.description: Update absolute position by offset

functions.name: module.setLabel
functions.description: Set the turtle label

functions.name: module.getLabel
functions.returns: string|nil # The turtle label
functions.description: Get the turtle label

functions.name: module.updateFuel
functions.description: Update fuel level from turtle API

functions.name: module.setFuel
functions.description: Set fuel level manually

functions.name: module.getFuel
functions.returns: number|nil # The fuel level
functions.description: Get the current fuel level

functions.name: module.buildPayload
functions.returns: table # The data payload
functions.description: Build the full data payload for syncing

functions.name: module.sync
functions.returns: string|nil # Error message if sync failed
functions.description: Sync all turtle data to the server

functions.name: module.syncStats
functions.returns: string|nil # Error message if sync failed
functions.description: Sync only stats to the server

functions.name: module.syncPosition
functions.returns: string|nil # Error message if sync failed
functions.description: Sync only position to the server

functions.name: module.fetch
functions.returns: table|nil # The turtle data or nil if not found
functions.description: Fetch turtle data from the server

functions.name: module.fetchAll
functions.returns: table|nil # Array of turtle data or nil on error
functions.description: Fetch all turtles from the server

functions.name: module.delete
functions.returns: string|nil # Error message if deletion failed
functions.description: Delete the current turtle from the server

functions.name: module.deleteById
functions.returns: string|nil # Error message if deletion failed
functions.description: Delete a specific turtle by ID from the server

functions.name: module.startAutoSync
functions.description: Start automatic syncing at a given interval

functions.name: module.stopAutoSync
functions.description: Stop automatic syncing

functions.name: module.isAutoSyncRunning
functions.returns: boolean # True if auto-sync is active
functions.description: Check if auto-sync is running

functions.name: module.forward
functions.returns: boolean # True if movement succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.forward() that updates relative position

functions.name: module.back
functions.returns: boolean # True if movement succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.back() that updates relative position

functions.name: module.up
functions.returns: boolean # True if movement succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.up() that updates relative position

functions.name: module.down
functions.returns: boolean # True if movement succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.down() that updates relative position

functions.name: module.dig
functions.returns: boolean # True if dig succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.dig() that increments blocks_mined stat

functions.name: module.digUp
functions.returns: boolean # True if dig succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.digUp() that increments blocks_mined stat

functions.name: module.digDown
functions.returns: boolean # True if dig succeeded
functions.description: Wrapper for turtle.digDown() that increments blocks_mined stat

functions.name: module._debug
functions.description: Print debug information about the current state

shopk.name: shopk
shopk.description: A Kromer cryptocurrency API client for ComputerCraft that provides real-time transaction monitoring and wallet operations through WebSocket connections. Features: Real-time transaction monitoring via WebSocket, automatic reconnection on connection loss, transaction sending with metadata support, wallet information retrieval, metadata parsing for structured data, and event-driven architecture.

functions.name: module.on

params.name: listener
params.description: Function to call when event occurs

functions.description: Register an event listener

functions.name: module.run
functions.description: Start the WebSocket connection and enter the main event loop This function blocks until the connection is closed

functions.name: module.close
functions.description: Close the WebSocket connection and stop reconnecting

functions.name: module.me

params.name: cb?
params.description: Optional callback to receive wallet data

functions.description: Get information about the current wallet

functions.name: module.send

params.name: cb?
params.description: Optional callback to receive transaction result

functions.description: Send a Kromer transaction

persist.name: persist
persist.description: A persistence module for ComputerCraft that provides automatic data serialization and storage to files with support for both Lua serialization and JSON formats. Features: Automatic file creation and loading, deep copy functionality to handle circular references, support for both Lua serialize and JSON formats, error handling with fallback mechanisms, array and object manipulation methods, and automatic saving on data changes.

s.name: s
s.description: A settings management module for ComputerCraft that provides interactive configuration with automatic validation, peripheral detection, and persistent storage using CC settings. Features: Interactive peripheral selection with type filtering, number input with range validation, string input with default values, boolean selection with menu interface, automatic settings persistence, peripheral availability checking and recovery, side-only peripheral filtering, and optional form UI integration.

functions.name: module.peripheral

params.name: sideOnly?
params.description: If true, only allow peripherals attached to computer sides

functions.returns: table # The wrapped peripheral object
functions.description: Get or configure a peripheral setting with automatic validation and recovery

functions.name: module.number

params.name: from?
params.description: Minimum allowed value (nil for no minimum)

params.name: to?
params.description: Maximum allowed value (nil for no maximum)

params.name: default?
params.description: Default value if user provides empty input

functions.returns: number # The configured number value
functions.description: Get or configure a number setting with range validation

functions.name: module.string

params.name: default?
params.description: Default value if user provides empty input

functions.returns: string # The configured string value
functions.description: Get or configure a string setting with optional default value

functions.name: module.boolean
functions.returns: boolean # The configured boolean value
functions.description: Get or configure a boolean setting using an interactive menu

functions.name: module.useForm
functions.returns: table # Form interface with peripheral, number, string, boolean, and submit functions
functions.description: Create a form-based settings interface using formui.lua Requires formui.lua to be installed. Returns a table with form-based versions of all s.lua functions.  local s = require("s") local form = s.useForm("My App Configuration")  local modem = form.peripheral("modem", "modem", true) local port = form.number("port", 1, 65535, 8080) local name = form.string("server_name", "MyServer") local enabled = form.boolean("enabled")  if form.submit() then print("Settings saved!") print("Modem:", modem()) print("Port:", port()) end

functions.name: formInterface.peripheral

params.name: type
params.description: The peripheral type to filter for

params.name: sideOnly?
params.description: If true, only show peripherals attached to computer sides

functions.returns: function # Getter function that returns the peripheral name
functions.description: Add a peripheral field to the form

functions.name: formInterface.number
functions.returns: function # Getter function that returns the number value
functions.description: Add a number field to the form

functions.name: formInterface.string
functions.returns: function # Getter function that returns the string value
functions.description: Add a string field to the form

functions.name: formInterface.boolean
functions.returns: function # Getter function that returns the boolean value
functions.description: Add a boolean field to the form

functions.name: formInterface.submit
functions.returns: boolean # True if submitted, false if cancelled
functions.description: Add submit and cancel buttons, then run the form

attach.name: attach
attach.description: A turtle utility module for ComputerCraft that provides safe block interaction, automatic tool management, and peripheral handling for turtles. Features: Automatic tool equipping based on action type (dig, attack, place), unsafe block protection to prevent accidentally digging storage blocks, peripheral auto-placement and wrapping, modem protection (never unequips modems), configurable default and always-equipped tools, and proxy wrappers for peripherals.

functions.name: module.setDefaultEquipped

params.name: leftTool
params.description: The tool to equip on the left side (e.g., "minecraft:diamond_pickaxe")

params.name: rightTool
params.description: The tool to equip on the right side (e.g., "minecraft:diamond_sword")

functions.description: Set the default tools to be equipped on each side

functions.name: module.setAlwaysEquipped

params.name: toolName
params.description: The tool that should always be equipped

functions.description: Set a tool that should always be kept equipped (has highest priority)

functions.name: module.wrap

params.name: peripheralName
params.description: The name/type of peripheral to wrap

params.name: side
params.description: The side to place/wrap the peripheral on ("top", "bottom", "front", "back", "left", "right")

functions.returns: table # A proxy table with all peripheral methods that auto-replaces if removed
functions.description: Wrap a peripheral, automatically placing it if not present

functions.name: module.find

params.name: peripheralType
params.description: The type of peripheral to find (e.g., "modem", "workbench")

functions.returns: table|nil # A proxy table with all peripheral methods, or nil if not found
functions.description: Find and wrap a peripheral by type, equipping it as a tool if necessary

functions.name: module._debug
functions.description: Print debug information about the module state, peripherals, and inventory Pauses between sections for user to read (press Enter to continue)

log.name: log
log.description: A logging utility module for ComputerCraft that provides colored console output and automatic file logging with daily log rotation. Features: Color-coded console output (red for errors, yellow for warnings, blue for info), automatic daily log file creation and rotation, persistent log storage in log/ directory, and timestamped log entries.

functions.name: module.info
functions.description: Log an informational message in blue

functions.name: module.warn
functions.description: Log a warning message in yellow

functions.name: module.error
functions.description: Log an error message in red

updater.name: updater
updater.description: A package updater module for CC-Misc utilities that checks for and installs updates programmatically using the GitHub API. Features: Check for available updates, programmatic package installation and updates, version comparison, dependency resolution, batch update operations, and JSON API integration.

functions.name: module.getLibraries
functions.returns: table|nil List of library info or nil on error
functions.description: Get information about all available libraries

functions.name: module.getLibraryInfo
functions.returns: table|nil Library info or nil on error
functions.description: Get information about a specific library

functions.name: module.checkUpdates
functions.returns: table List of libraries with available updates
functions.description: Check for updates to installed libraries

functions.name: module.hasUpdate
functions.returns: boolean, string|nil, string|nil Has update, current version, latest version
functions.description: Check if a specific library has an update available

functions.name: module.update
functions.returns: boolean Success
functions.description: Install or update a library

functions.name: module.updateAll
functions.returns: number Number of successful updates
functions.description: Update all installed libraries that have updates available

functions.name: module.listInstalled
functions.returns: table List of {name, version, path} for installed libraries
functions.description: List all installed libraries with their versions

functions.name: module.install
functions.returns: boolean Success
functions.description: Install a new library with its dependencies

tables.name: tables
tables.description: A utility module for table operations in ComputerCraft providing common table manipulation functions like searching, counting, copying, and comparison operations. Features: Element existence checking with includes(), table size counting for any table type, deep recursive copying with nested table support, deep recursive equality comparison, and works with both array-like and associative tables.

functions.name: tables.includes
functions.returns: boolean # True if the object is found in the table
functions.description: Check if a table contains a specific value

functions.name: tables.count

params.name: table
params.description: The table to count elements in

functions.returns: number # The number of key-value pairs in the table
functions.description: Count the number of elements in a table (works with both arrays and associative tables)

functions.name: tables.recursiveCopy
functions.returns: table # A new table with all values copied (nested tables are also copied)
functions.description: Create a deep copy of a table, recursively copying all nested tables

functions.name: tables.recursiveEquals
functions.returns: boolean # True if both tables have the same structure and values
functions.description: Compare two tables for deep equality, recursively checking nested tables

timeutil.name: timeutil
timeutil.description: A timing utility module for ComputerCraft that provides persistent interval management with two different timing modes: absolute time-based and accumulated runtime-based. Features: Absolute time intervals (based on system time), accumulated time intervals (based on actual runtime), persistent state across computer restarts, pretty-printed time formatting, manual execution control, and automatic interval management with run loop.

functions.name: module.every

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback function to execute when interval triggers

params.name: fileName
params.description: File path to persist the last run timestamp

functions.returns: TimeutilInterval # Interval object with control methods
functions.description: Create an absolute time-based interval that runs based on system time This type of interval will "catch up" if the computer was offline, running immediately if the interval time has passed since the last recorded execution.

functions.name: module.everyLoaded

params.name: cb
params.description: Callback function to execute when interval triggers

params.name: intervalTime
params.description: Interval duration in seconds of actual runtime

params.name: fileName
params.description: File path to persist the accumulated elapsed time

functions.returns: TimeutilInterval # Interval object with control methods
functions.description: Create a runtime-based interval that accumulates time only when the program is running This type of interval will NOT catch up after downtime, only counting actual runtime. Useful for operations that should happen after X seconds of actual program execution.

functions.name: module.run
functions.description: Start the main interval management loop This function blocks and continuously checks all registered intervals, executing them when their time has elapsed. Runs indefinitely until terminated.

functions.name: module.getRelativeTime
functions.returns: string # Formatted time string (e.g., "5.2 minutes", "1 day", "30 seconds")
functions.description: Format a duration in seconds into a human-readable relative time string

formui.name: formui
formui.description: A dynamic form user interface library for ComputerCraft that provides interactive forms with various field types, validation, and peripheral detection. Features: Text and number input fields, select dropdowns and peripheral selection, checkbox/toggle fields, multi-select dropdowns, list fields with item management, built-in validation system, labels and buttons, real-time peripheral detection, keyboard navigation with arrow keys, and form submission and cancellation.

functions.name: FormUI.new
functions.returns: FormUI # New FormUI instance
functions.description: Create a new FormUI instance

functions.name: FormUI:addField
functions.returns: fun(): any # Function that returns the field's final value after form submission
functions.description: Add a field to the form and return a getter function

functions.name: FormUI:text
functions.returns: fun(): string # Function to get the field value after submission
functions.description: Add a text input field

functions.name: FormUI:number
functions.returns: fun(): number # Function to get the field value after submission
functions.description: Add a number input field

functions.name: FormUI:select
functions.returns: fun(): string # Function to get the selected option after submission
functions.description: Add a select dropdown field

functions.name: FormUI:peripheral
functions.returns: fun(): string # Function to get the selected peripheral name after submission
functions.description: Add a peripheral selector field that automatically detects peripherals

functions.name: FormUI:label
functions.returns: fun(): string # Function to get the label text (always returns the same text)
functions.description: Add a non-interactive label for display purposes

functions.name: FormUI:button
functions.returns: fun(): string # Function to get the button text
functions.description: Add a button that can trigger actions

functions.name: FormUI:checkbox
functions.returns: fun(): boolean # Function to get the field value after submission
functions.description: Add a checkbox/toggle field

functions.name: FormUI:multiselect
functions.returns: fun(): string[] # Function to get selected options after submission
functions.description: Add a multi-select dropdown field

functions.name: FormUI:list
functions.returns: fun(): table # Function to get the list after submission
functions.description: Add a list field (string or number list, with item reordering)

functions.name: FormUI:addSubmitCancel
functions.description: Add standard Submit and Cancel buttons to the form

functions.name: FormUI:validateField
functions.returns: string? error Error message if validation failed
functions.description: Validate a specific field by index

functions.name: FormUI:isValid
functions.returns: boolean # True if all fields are valid
functions.description: Validate all fields in the form

functions.name: FormUI:get
functions.returns: any # The field's current value, or nil if not found
functions.description: Get the current value of a field by label

functions.name: FormUI:setValue
functions.returns: boolean # True if field was found and updated, false otherwise
functions.description: Set the value of a field by label

functions.name: FormUI:draw
functions.description: Draw the form to the terminal

functions.name: FormUI:edit
functions.returns: string? action Action identifier if a button was pressed
functions.description: Edit a field at the specified index

functions.name: FormUI:nextSelectableField
functions.returns: number # Next selectable field index (wraps around)
functions.description: Find the next selectable field index (skips labels)

functions.name: FormUI:prevSelectableField
functions.returns: number # Previous selectable field index (wraps around)
functions.description: Find the previous selectable field index (skips labels)

functions.name: FormUI:run
functions.returns: FormResult? result Table of field values indexed by label, or nil if cancelled
functions.description: Run the form's main input loop
